intro: Diploclinium arnottianum, commonly known as the Australian flatweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a weed in some regions.
